channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12630] Provide capability for dropping malfunctioning ConfigurationObserver automatically
item.description:
Chatting with Manukranth, online config update feature should handle the case where certain ConfigurationObserver(s) constantly produce exception when notified of config update.

We can handle such ConfigurationObserver by sidelining it after configurable number of exceptions seen from the ConfigurationObserver.
item.summary: Provide capability for dropping malfunctioning ConfigurationObserver automatically

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Hi Ted Yu

We can handle such ConfigurationObserver by sidelining it after configurable number of exceptions seen from the ConfigurationObserver.

By sidelining you mean deregister it from ConfigurationObserver ?

Introduced a new configuration "hbase.configuration.observer.max.exception.retries" with default value of 10.
If a observer throws exception continuously for 10 times(default) or user configured value while updating its configuration then it will deregister the observer.

Attached patch is for trunk branch.
Please review and share your comments.
Thanks

Test failure is not related to the patch.

+  private Map<ConfigurationObserver, Integer> trackConfigurationObserversException =

How about naming the above map configurationObserverExceptionTracker ?


+          + ") failed in updating the configuration continuosly for more than " + maxRetries

Typo: continuosly


+    int maxRetries =

+        conf.getInt(HConstants.HBASE_CONFIGURATION_OBSERVER_MAX_EXCEPTION_RETRIES,

+          HConstants.HBASE_CONFIGURATION_OBSERVER_MAX_EXCEPTION_RETRIES_DEFAULT);

There is no need to retrieve the max retry count every time, right ?


+  public Map<ConfigurationObserver, Integer> getTrackConfigurationObserversException() {

...

+  public void setTrackConfigurationObserversException(

Where are the above methods accessed ?

Looks like the hanging test was caused by the addition of the Map.
Can you expand the following data structure to include count of failed notifications ?


  private Set<ConfigurationObserver> configurationObservers =

    Collections.newSetFromMap(new WeakHashMap<ConfigurationObserver,

                                              Boolean>());
Why we need this? If problematic config, load a replacement or a restore?

Thanks for the reviews Ted Yu

How about naming the above map configurationObserverExceptionTracker ?

Looks better. Addressed in v3.

Typo: continuosly

Addressed in v3.

There is no need to retrieve the max retry count every time, right ?

Yes. Addressed in v3.

Where are the above methods accessed ?

Not used removed them in v3.

Can you expand the following data structure to include count of failed notifications ?

I did not won't to change the existing map structure. Instead changed configurationObserverExceptionTracker from HashMap to WeakHashMap.

Why we need this? If problematic config, load a replacement or a restore?

Stack, I am not pretty sure why we are doing this way!
Ted Yu or Manukranth Kolloju will have a answer to this.
As shown in description, this JIRA handles ConfigurationObserver(s) which constantly produce exception when notified.

As shown in description, this JIRA handles ConfigurationObserver(s) which constantly produce exception when notified.

Description 'shows' nothing other than that you are probably harrassing Manukranth Kolloju offline. Is this a problem? Has it been observed in the wild?

Stack, I am not pretty sure why we are doing this way!

Ashish Singhi You do good work. Suggest you pick clean issues that clearly move the project forward. If you need input, just ask on dev list (Stuff marked critical or major against 1.0 would be good in general. I am not sure why this issue is marked major for 1.0... how often are folks deploying new classes with ConfigurationObserver implementations?)

This message is automatically generated.

This problem wasn't observed in any prod system of ours. Ted Yu suggested that it would be nice to have to handle the cases where the observers might hit an exception and stay in that case. This was a speculative case, but the idea wasn't bad. But, the priority of the Jira should have not been MAJOR/MINOR. I took a look at the patch, I don't really think that we should be storing this extra map for the sake of a speculative case.
